    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void changelevel()
      The level Index is increased and checks if there are more levels.
      void changetilefromgreentored()
      The function changes the green trail tiles in the map to red from where the enemy touched it
      void changingMapforFill()
      This function is used for the floodfill The map is cloned and flood filled the regions from the nemies positions with a placeholder The null position in the map is filled and the placeholder is replaced with null (empty space)
      void dead()
      This function decreases the lives of the player and resets the ball position
      void dfs(java.lang.String[][] grid, int x, int y)
      The dfs fucntion which fill all regions in all four directions from the given input
      void draw()
      Draw all elements in the game by current frame.
      void floodFill(java.lang.String[][] grid, int x, int y)
      This is the function to call the dfs recursive function for floodfill.
      boolean gameResult()
      The final result text is shown with this function.
      boolean informationBar()
      The information bar is created here.
      void keyPressed()
      Checks which key the player pressed and the movement of the ball is adjusted accordingly
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args) 
      double[] mapDraw()
      The map elements such as grass, concrete, green trail, red trail and powerups are drawn here on the window “X” = concrete “O” = Green Trail “R” = Red Trail “G” = Grass “P1” = Power Up 1 “P2” = Power Up 2
      int[] pickRandomLocation()
      A random location on the map is selected (which is empty)
      void powerup1()
      Powerup 1 logic.
      void powerup2()
      Powerup 2 logic.
      void readFile()
      The current level elements is determined from the JSON file and loaded in.
      void settings()
      Initialise the setting of the window size.
      void setup()
      Load all resources such as images.

    • Method Detail

      • settings

        public void settings()
        Initialise the setting of the window size.
        Overrides:
        settings in class processing.core.PApplet

      • setup

        public void setup()
        Load all resources such as images. Initialise the elements such as the player, enemies and map elements. Also read in the Json file and create the font.
        Overrides:
        setup in class processing.core.PApplet

      • readFile

        public void readFile()
        The current level elements is determined from the JSON file and loaded in.

      • draw

        public void draw()
        Draw all elements in the game by current frame.
        Overrides:
        draw in class processing.core.PApplet

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed()
        Checks which key the player pressed and the movement of the ball is adjusted accordingly
        Overrides:
        keyPressed in class processing.core.PApplet

      • mapDraw

        public double[] mapDraw()
        The map elements such as grass, concrete, green trail, red trail and powerups are drawn here on the window “X” = concrete “O” = Green Trail “R” = Red Trail “G” = Grass “P1” = Power Up 1 “P2” = Power Up 2
        Returns:
        the numerator and denominator for area covered

      • dead

        public void dead()
        This function decreases the lives of the player and resets the ball position

      • informationBar

        public boolean informationBar()
        The information bar is created here. All text at the top is written here.
        Returns:
        if no issues occurred

      • gameResult

        public boolean gameResult()
        The final result text is shown with this function. The player wins if they complete the levels The player loses if it has no lives left.
        Returns:
        true if the player wins false otherwise

      • powerup1

        public void powerup1()
        Powerup 1 logic. This powerup spawns after 10 seconds into the game and is on the map for 10 seconds When collected the effect stays for 10 secinds. The timer of these are called here.

      • changetilefromgreentored

        public void changetilefromgreentored()
        The function changes the green trail tiles in the map to red from where the enemy touched it

      • powerup2

        public void powerup2()
        Powerup 2 logic. This powerup spawns after 15 seconds into the game and is on the map for 10 seconds If red tiles are present they are changed to green tiles.

      • changelevel

        public void changelevel()
        The level Index is increased and checks if there are more levels. If there are more levels, the game file of the next level is read and the game is resetted accordingly.

      • pickRandomLocation

        public int[] pickRandomLocation()
        A random location on the map is selected (which is empty)
        Returns:
        the random empty location on the map

      • changingMapforFill

        public void changingMapforFill()
        This function is used for the floodfill The map is cloned and flood filled the regions from the nemies positions with a placeholder The null position in the map is filled and the placeholder is replaced with null (empty space)

      • floodFill

        public void floodFill(java.lang.String[][] grid,
                      int x,
                      int y)
        This is the function to call the dfs recursive function for floodfill. This method is taken from a youtube video tutorial
        Parameters:
        grid - is the map
        x - the x coordinate of the starting position of the floodfill
        y - the y coordinate of the starting position of the floodfill

      • dfs

        public void dfs(java.lang.String[][] grid,
                int x,
                int y)
        The dfs fucntion which fill all regions in all four directions from the given input
        Parameters:
        grid - is the map
        x - the x coordinate of the starting position of the floodfill dfs
        y - the y coordinate of the starting position of the floodfill dfs

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
